security_audit.summary: This is a pure narrative content skill with no executable code. It contains only markdown documentation for an interactive fiction game chapter about first alien contact. No security risks detected.

best_practices: Maintain scientific curiosity while building tension during encounters
Use both verbal and non-verbal communication methods for realism
Respect alien intelligence - avoid colonizer mindset in interactions
anti_patterns: Don't make aliens purely monstrous or universally hostile
Avoid instant perfect communication - build barriers realistically
Skip deus ex machina solutions - let relationships develop naturally

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with English prompts?
faq.answer: The skill content is in Chinese, but you can interact with it using English prompts and Claude will translate appropriately.

faq.question: How long are the encounter scenarios?
faq.answer: Each chapter runs 30-40 minutes with multiple branching paths and endings based on player choices.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with other story chapters?
faq.answer: Yes, this is chapter 8 of a 12-chapter series that can be played in any order or sequence.

faq.question: Is player data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, this is pure narrative content with no data collection, network calls, or file system access.

faq.question: What if the alien encounter goes wrong?
faq.answer: The skill includes multiple endings - peaceful, cautious, and deep connection outcomes based on your choices.

faq.question: How does this compare to other sci-fi writing tools?
faq.answer: This focuses specifically on first contact scenarios with emphasis on realistic communication challenges and cultural respect.
